text: Serious question - How does one edit custom module settings for a blog listing page?
I have a custom module loaded into the listing page for a blog but I have NO idea how to edit those settings
coded template or drag n drop?
If it’s in the listing it would be using the module default values
Coded
if you’re using a drag n drop template you can do template level defaults(they override the module defaults)
Is this just a missing feature (the ability to view a blog’s listing page to edit modules)
for coded here’s my suggestion, drop the module into a dummy drag n drop, copy as global module, then change all the settings to what you want and use the global modules snippet
Interesting idea… If I was the only one touching this I’d definitely use it

As it stands I have to pass this off to someone and be able to explain that “you go here to make changes to it” to which they’d respond “wait, is this the blog template?” and I say “no, you can’t edit it anywhere, so you have to go to this random ‘settings’ page elsewhere”
just throw a comment in with a link to the global module in the design manager
Another solution if a marketer is the one who needs to modify it. HubDB it
I’m dropping the interface view of the Listing Page for blogs into Ideas
This feels like something that should exist
is there a way to run an embed script for a github Gist, or codepen or whatnot, in a blog post?
I know you can use <code></code> but I'm hoping for something more robust
Nix that, just realized iframes will still load. Would love a solution for embed scripts as well though :smile:
Are you trying to display code? I’d just throw it in a codepen embed and pop that into your post
otherwise you need to style a Pre element and maybe find a library to add line-numbers and all that jazz
ya I can do the codepen embed with the iframe, which is fine for now. Was hoping there was a way to have the embed <script> run as well as an alternative

I think that actually should work as long as you do the insert>embed and then go to the embed tab and paste it.

Like you’d do when embedding a video
If you don’t use that tool HS’s editor might mangle the script
ohh good call, I hadn't thought of that
hi, i really need to put a slider in a custom module, and it worked for our old custom modules but now they are broken and unuseful. How can we make it work? i need help with this :disappointed:

<@U6Z3FRJ2D> try using slick.js: <http://kenwheeler.github.io/slick/>

Take the dependent js and css files and plug them into the design manager then link to them in the custom module. Instructions for use are no the website and pretty simple.
